result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kodi M Haines

records.addlTxt: To defendant with copy of court appointed attorney bill and balance due.
Court Appointed Attorney fees in the amount of $482.86 for Attorney Klemish.

Conditions: 
No contact with A.A.
Electronic and in person contact with A.E. is allowed for child exchange and care purposes in a public place.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through third party.

9:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kodi M Haines in court.  Attorney Vanessa A Klemish in court for Kodi M Haines. There is an agreement. Defendant enters a  guilty plea to Count 1 Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea. Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement is filed with and accepted by the Court. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 30, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on March 30, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Letter to defendant with signature bond ordered in court 03/30/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 04/11/2022.

Conditions:

Electronic and in person contact with A.E. is allowed for child exchange and care purposes in a public place. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
